paper_title: Fabricated g-C3N4/Ag/m-CeO2 composite photocatalyst for enhanced photoconversion of CO2

catalyst.source: Fabricated g-C3N4/Ag/m-CeO2 composite photocatalyst for enhanced photoconversion of CO2
catalyst.context: Fabricated g-C3N4/Ag/m-CeO2 composite photocatalyst for enhanced photoconversion of CO2

catalyst.source: The photocatalytic activity results show that when the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite exhibits the superiority activity for CO 2 photoconversion to CO (13.94 mol/g) and CH 4 (7.39 mol/g) under UV-irradiation in 10 h.
catalyst.context: In this work, the ordered mesoporous CeO 2 (m-CeO 2 ) was successfully fabricated via the nanocasting pathway, through using SBA-15 as a hard template.Besides, g-C 3 N 4 /Ag/m-CeO 2 composite was successfully constructed by calcination method.Meanwhile, the obtained samples were investigated by series of test techniques.The XRD, SEM and TEM results show that the m-CeO 2 and Ag/m-CeO 2 with the ordered mesoporous trait.Besides, the EPR, Raman and XPS results suggest that the oxygen vacancies (O v ) and Ce 3 and Ce 4 are in g-C 3 N 4 /Ag/m-CeO 2 .In addition, the ordered mesostructure is favorable for the CO 2 molecular movement and adsorption/ desorption reaction.The g-C 3 N 4 nanosheets, a promising material possessing suitable conductor band, large specific area, non-toxicity, and outstanding chemical stability, is a candidate semiconductor for CO 2 conversion.The introduction of g-C 3 N 4 nanosheets to Ag/m-CeO 2 overcomes the photocorrosion of Ag nanoparticles and Ag facilitate the transfer of photogenerated electrons.The photocatalytic activity results show that when the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite exhibits the superiority activity for CO 2 photoconversion to CO (13.94 mol/g) and CH 4 (7.39 mol/g) under UV-irradiation in 10 h.

catalyst.source: The g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst was successfully prepared by photodeposition and calcination pathway.
catalyst.context: The g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst was successfully prepared by photodeposition and calcination pathway.SEM, TEM and HRTEM images show that Ag nanoparticles are randomly distributed on the surface of m-CeO 2 , and g-C 3 N 4 successfully coated onto Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the photocatalytic activity of the binary composite photocatalyst is the best, and the yield of CO and CH 4 are 13.94 mol/g and 7.39 mol/g, respectively.Ag acts as the bridge for g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 electron transport during the reaction, increasing the migration rate and electron utilization of photogenerated carriers, enhancing photocatalytic activity.In addition, the coating of g-C 3 N 4 nanosheets can inhibit the photocorrosion of Ag to some extent, and the photoconversion of g-C 3 N 4 / 7Ag/m-CeO 2 shows higher than that of bare m-CeO 2 .In this work, m-CeO 2 combined with g-C 3 N 4 and Ag, which may offer an alternative way to develop high-efficient and low-cost CO 2 photoreduction photocatalysts. Huiqin Wang and Pengwei Huo: Relationship among the structural, textural, optical, electrochemical properties; Jingru Guan: XPS, Preparation of photocatalyst and the photocatalytic activity; Jinze Li and Xin Li: AFM and Photoelectrochemical measurement; Changchang Ma: Raman spectroscopy and DRS; Yongsheng Yan: Discussion the photocatalytic processes.All authors participated on the preparation of manuscript. The authors declared that there is no conflict of interest. Fig. 1.(a) Low-angle XRD paterns and (b) wide-angle XRD paterns of as-synthesized different samples. Fig. 2. SEM images of (a) SBA-15, (b) m-CeO 2 , (c) 7Ag/m-CeO 2 , (d, e) g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 .The SEM-EDS of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 . (a) is the survey spectra of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 , g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 .It is clearly seen that C, N, O, Ce and Ag elements are contained in g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite; C and N elements, O and Ce belong g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 , respectively.The C 1s spectrum of g-C 3 N 4 can be deconvoluted into three main peaks at 284.64 eV, 286.28 eV and 288.23 eV corresponding to g-C 3 N 4 typical C-NH 2 , CeN) 3 and NeCN groups Fig. 4. XPS spectra of as-synthesized photocatalyst samples (a) survey, (b) C 1s, (c) N 1s, (d) O 1s, (e) Ce 3d and (f) Ag 3d. Fig.10shows the yield of CO and CH 4 converted from CO 2 by different photocatalysts under UV-light irradiation for 10 h.It is obviously seen that composite photocatalysts present excellent photocatalytic activity than that of m-CeO 2 .The result shows that the yields of CO and CH 4 are up to 15.36 mol/g and 8.02 mol/g for g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/CeO 2 , respectively.For bare m-CeO 2 , the generation of CO and CH 4 reach to Fig.7.The N 2 adsorption/desorption isotherm curves of m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 photocatalysts (a) and corresponding pore size distribution curves (b). Photocurrent (A/cm2 ) Fig. 9. (a) The transient photocurrent spectra and (b) corresponding EIS Nyquist plots of m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 photocatalyst, respectively. Fig. 11.g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst five-cycle experimental diagram (a) and XRD patterns before and after the fifth cycle. Fig. 12. Schematic illustration of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst for CO 2 photoconversion under UV-light irradiation. EO 20PO 70EO 20, 5800) and TEOS were purchased from Sigma-Aldrich Reagent Co., Ltd.HCl (36-38), vitamin C, sodium hydroxide (NaOH, AR), triethanolamine (TEOA, AR) and urea (CON 2 H 4 , CR) were get from Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.Cerium nitrate hexahydrate (Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O, AR), polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP, k30, AR) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 , AR) were purchased from Aladdin Chemical Reagent Co. Ltd. 1.04 mol/g and 0.64 mol/g, respectively.The yields of other photocatalysts of CO can reach 6.95 mol/g, 9.13 mol/g, 11.00 mol/g, 13.44 mol/g and 11.44 mol/g for 1Ag/m-CeO 2 , 3Ag/m-CeO 2 , 5Ag/ m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and 9Ag/m-CeO 2 , respectively.Besides, 2.63 mol/g, 5.01 mol/g, 5.31 mol/g, 6.90 mol/g and 6.11 mol/g of CH 4 are generated after irradiation for 10 h.The results demonstrate that as the Ag load increases, the photocatalytic activity of binary composite photocatalysts gradually increases and then decreases.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the binary photocatalyst has superior photocatalytic activity.The reason can be ascribed to Ag particles are formed on the surface of m-CeO 2 . We gratefully acknowledge the financial support of the National Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant No. 21776117), China Postdoctoral Science Foundation (2017M611734), Six talent peaks project in Jiangsu Province (Grant No. XCL-014). Supplementary data to this article can be found online at https:// doi.org/10.1016/j.apsusc.2019.144931.

catalyst.source: The result shows that the yields of CO and CH 4 are up to 15.36 mol/g and 8.02 mol/g for g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/CeO 2 , respectively.
catalyst.context: The g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst was successfully prepared by photodeposition and calcination pathway.SEM, TEM and HRTEM images show that Ag nanoparticles are randomly distributed on the surface of m-CeO 2 , and g-C 3 N 4 successfully coated onto Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the photocatalytic activity of the binary composite photocatalyst is the best, and the yield of CO and CH 4 are 13.94 mol/g and 7.39 mol/g, respectively.Ag acts as the bridge for g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 electron transport during the reaction, increasing the migration rate and electron utilization of photogenerated carriers, enhancing photocatalytic activity.In addition, the coating of g-C 3 N 4 nanosheets can inhibit the photocorrosion of Ag to some extent, and the photoconversion of g-C 3 N 4 / 7Ag/m-CeO 2 shows higher than that of bare m-CeO 2 .In this work, m-CeO 2 combined with g-C 3 N 4 and Ag, which may offer an alternative way to develop high-efficient and low-cost CO 2 photoreduction photocatalysts. Huiqin Wang and Pengwei Huo: Relationship among the structural, textural, optical, electrochemical properties; Jingru Guan: XPS, Preparation of photocatalyst and the photocatalytic activity; Jinze Li and Xin Li: AFM and Photoelectrochemical measurement; Changchang Ma: Raman spectroscopy and DRS; Yongsheng Yan: Discussion the photocatalytic processes.All authors participated on the preparation of manuscript. The authors declared that there is no conflict of interest. Fig. 1.(a) Low-angle XRD paterns and (b) wide-angle XRD paterns of as-synthesized different samples. Fig. 2. SEM images of (a) SBA-15, (b) m-CeO 2 , (c) 7Ag/m-CeO 2 , (d, e) g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 .The SEM-EDS of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 . (a) is the survey spectra of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 , g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 .It is clearly seen that C, N, O, Ce and Ag elements are contained in g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite; C and N elements, O and Ce belong g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 , respectively.The C 1s spectrum of g-C 3 N 4 can be deconvoluted into three main peaks at 284.64 eV, 286.28 eV and 288.23 eV corresponding to g-C 3 N 4 typical C-NH 2 , CeN) 3 and NeCN groups Fig. 4. XPS spectra of as-synthesized photocatalyst samples (a) survey, (b) C 1s, (c) N 1s, (d) O 1s, (e) Ce 3d and (f) Ag 3d. Fig.10shows the yield of CO and CH 4 converted from CO 2 by different photocatalysts under UV-light irradiation for 10 h.It is obviously seen that composite photocatalysts present excellent photocatalytic activity than that of m-CeO 2 .The result shows that the yields of CO and CH 4 are up to 15.36 mol/g and 8.02 mol/g for g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/CeO 2 , respectively.For bare m-CeO 2 , the generation of CO and CH 4 reach to Fig.7.The N 2 adsorption/desorption isotherm curves of m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 photocatalysts (a) and corresponding pore size distribution curves (b). Photocurrent (A/cm2 ) Fig. 9. (a) The transient photocurrent spectra and (b) corresponding EIS Nyquist plots of m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 photocatalyst, respectively. Fig. 11.g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst five-cycle experimental diagram (a) and XRD patterns before and after the fifth cycle. Fig. 12. Schematic illustration of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst for CO 2 photoconversion under UV-light irradiation. EO 20PO 70EO 20, 5800) and TEOS were purchased from Sigma-Aldrich Reagent Co., Ltd.HCl (36-38), vitamin C, sodium hydroxide (NaOH, AR), triethanolamine (TEOA, AR) and urea (CON 2 H 4 , CR) were get from Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.Cerium nitrate hexahydrate (Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O, AR), polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP, k30, AR) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 , AR) were purchased from Aladdin Chemical Reagent Co. Ltd. 1.04 mol/g and 0.64 mol/g, respectively.The yields of other photocatalysts of CO can reach 6.95 mol/g, 9.13 mol/g, 11.00 mol/g, 13.44 mol/g and 11.44 mol/g for 1Ag/m-CeO 2 , 3Ag/m-CeO 2 , 5Ag/ m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and 9Ag/m-CeO 2 , respectively.Besides, 2.63 mol/g, 5.01 mol/g, 5.31 mol/g, 6.90 mol/g and 6.11 mol/g of CH 4 are generated after irradiation for 10 h.The results demonstrate that as the Ag load increases, the photocatalytic activity of binary composite photocatalysts gradually increases and then decreases.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the binary photocatalyst has superior photocatalytic activity.The reason can be ascribed to Ag particles are formed on the surface of m-CeO 2 . We gratefully acknowledge the financial support of the National Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant No. 21776117), China Postdoctoral Science Foundation (2017M611734), Six talent peaks project in Jiangsu Province (Grant No. XCL-014). Supplementary data to this article can be found online at https:// doi.org/10.1016/j.apsusc.2019.144931.

catalyst.context: The g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst was successfully prepared by photodeposition and calcination pathway.SEM, TEM and HRTEM images show that Ag nanoparticles are randomly distributed on the surface of m-CeO 2 , and g-C 3 N 4 successfully coated onto Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the photocatalytic activity of the binary composite photocatalyst is the best, and the yield of CO and CH 4 are 13.94 mol/g and 7.39 mol/g, respectively.Ag acts as the bridge for g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 electron transport during the reaction, increasing the migration rate and electron utilization of photogenerated carriers, enhancing photocatalytic activity.In addition, the coating of g-C 3 N 4 nanosheets can inhibit the photocorrosion of Ag to some extent, and the photoconversion of g-C 3 N 4 / 7Ag/m-CeO 2 shows higher than that of bare m-CeO 2 .In this work, m-CeO 2 combined with g-C 3 N 4 and Ag, which may offer an alternative way to develop high-efficient and low-cost CO 2 photoreduction photocatalysts. Photocurrent (A/cm2 ) Fig. 9. (a) The transient photocurrent spectra and (b) corresponding EIS Nyquist plots of m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 photocatalyst, respectively. Fig. 11.g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst five-cycle experimental diagram (a) and XRD patterns before and after the fifth cycle. Fig. 12. Schematic illustration of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst for CO 2 photoconversion under UV-light irradiation. EO 20PO 70EO 20, 5800) and TEOS were purchased from Sigma-Aldrich Reagent Co., Ltd.HCl (36-38), vitamin C, sodium hydroxide (NaOH, AR), triethanolamine (TEOA, AR) and urea (CON 2 H 4 , CR) were get from Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.Cerium nitrate hexahydrate (Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O, AR), polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP, k30, AR) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 , AR) were purchased from Aladdin Chemical Reagent Co. Ltd. 1.04 mol/g and 0.64 mol/g, respectively.The yields of other photocatalysts of CO can reach 6.95 mol/g, 9.13 mol/g, 11.00 mol/g, 13.44 mol/g and 11.44 mol/g for 1Ag/m-CeO 2 , 3Ag/m-CeO 2 , 5Ag/ m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and 9Ag/m-CeO 2 , respectively.Besides, 2.63 mol/g, 5.01 mol/g, 5.31 mol/g, 6.90 mol/g and 6.11 mol/g of CH 4 are generated after irradiation for 10 h.The results demonstrate that as the Ag load increases, the photocatalytic activity of binary composite photocatalysts gradually increases and then decreases.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the binary photocatalyst has superior photocatalytic activity.The reason can be ascribed to Ag particles are formed on the surface of m-CeO 2 . catalyst.context: The g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst was successfully prepared by photodeposition and calcination pathway.SEM, TEM and HRTEM images show that Ag nanoparticles are randomly distributed on the surface of m-CeO 2 , and g-C 3 N 4 successfully coated onto Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the photocatalytic activity of the binary composite photocatalyst is the best, and the yield of CO and CH 4 are 13.94 mol/g and 7.39 mol/g, respectively.Ag acts as the bridge for g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 electron transport during the reaction, increasing the migration rate and electron utilization of photogenerated carriers, enhancing photocatalytic activity.In addition, the coating of g-C 3 N 4 nanosheets can inhibit the photocorrosion of Ag to some extent, and the photoconversion of g-C 3 N 4 / 7Ag/m-CeO 2 shows higher than that of bare m-CeO 2 .In this work, m-CeO 2 combined with g-C 3 N 4 and Ag, which may offer an alternative way to develop high-efficient and low-cost CO 2 photoreduction photocatalysts. EO 20PO 70EO 20, 5800) and TEOS were purchased from Sigma-Aldrich Reagent Co., Ltd.HCl (36-38), vitamin C, sodium hydroxide (NaOH, AR), triethanolamine (TEOA, AR) and urea (CON 2 H 4 , CR) were get from Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.Cerium nitrate hexahydrate (Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O, AR), polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP, k30, AR) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 , AR) were purchased from Aladdin Chemical Reagent Co. Ltd. 1.04 mol/g and 0.64 mol/g, respectively.The yields of other photocatalysts of CO can reach 6.95 mol/g, 9.13 mol/g, 11.00 mol/g, 13.44 mol/g and 11.44 mol/g for 1Ag/m-CeO 2 , 3Ag/m-CeO 2 , 5Ag/ m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and 9Ag/m-CeO 2 , respectively.Besides, 2.63 mol/g, 5.01 mol/g, 5.31 mol/g, 6.90 mol/g and 6.11 mol/g of CH 4 are generated after irradiation for 10 h.The results demonstrate that as the Ag load increases, the photocatalytic activity of binary composite photocatalysts gradually increases and then decreases.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the binary photocatalyst has superior photocatalytic activity.The reason can be ascribed to Ag particles are formed on the surface of m-CeO 2 . We gratefully acknowledge the financial support of the National Natural Science Foundation of China (Grant No. 21776117), China Postdoctoral Science Foundation (2017M611734), Six talent peaks project in Jiangsu Province (Grant No. XCL-014). Supplementary data to this article can be found online at https:// doi.org/10.1016/j.apsusc.2019.144931.

catalyst.source: The yields of other photocatalysts of CO can reach 6.95 mol/g, 9.13 mol/g, 11.00 mol/g, 13.44 mol/g and 11.44 mol/g for 1Ag/m-CeO 2 , 3Ag/m-CeO 2 , 5Ag/ m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and 9Ag/m-CeO 2 , respectively.
catalyst.context: The g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst was successfully prepared by photodeposition and calcination pathway.SEM, TEM and HRTEM images show that Ag nanoparticles are randomly distributed on the surface of m-CeO 2 , and g-C 3 N 4 successfully coated onto Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the photocatalytic activity of the binary composite photocatalyst is the best, and the yield of CO and CH 4 are 13.94 mol/g and 7.39 mol/g, respectively.Ag acts as the bridge for g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 electron transport during the reaction, increasing the migration rate and electron utilization of photogenerated carriers, enhancing photocatalytic activity.In addition, the coating of g-C 3 N 4 nanosheets can inhibit the photocorrosion of Ag to some extent, and the photoconversion of g-C 3 N 4 / 7Ag/m-CeO 2 shows higher than that of bare m-CeO 2 .In this work, m-CeO 2 combined with g-C 3 N 4 and Ag, which may offer an alternative way to develop high-efficient and low-cost CO 2 photoreduction photocatalysts. Huiqin Wang and Pengwei Huo: Relationship among the structural, textural, optical, electrochemical properties; Jingru Guan: XPS, Preparation of photocatalyst and the photocatalytic activity; Jinze Li and Xin Li: AFM and Photoelectrochemical measurement; Changchang Ma: Raman spectroscopy and DRS; Yongsheng Yan: Discussion the photocatalytic processes.All authors participated on the preparation of manuscript. The authors declared that there is no conflict of interest. Fig. 1.(a) Low-angle XRD paterns and (b) wide-angle XRD paterns of as-synthesized different samples. Fig. 2. SEM images of (a) SBA-15, (b) m-CeO 2 , (c) 7Ag/m-CeO 2 , (d, e) g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 .The SEM-EDS of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 . (a) is the survey spectra of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 , g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 .It is clearly seen that C, N, O, Ce and Ag elements are contained in g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite; C and N elements, O and Ce belong g-C 3 N 4 and m-CeO 2 , respectively.The C 1s spectrum of g-C 3 N 4 can be deconvoluted into three main peaks at 284.64 eV, 286.28 eV and 288.23 eV corresponding to g-C 3 N 4 typical C-NH 2 , CeN) 3 and NeCN groups Fig. 4. XPS spectra of as-synthesized photocatalyst samples (a) survey, (b) C 1s, (c) N 1s, (d) O 1s, (e) Ce 3d and (f) Ag 3d. Fig.10shows the yield of CO and CH 4 converted from CO 2 by different photocatalysts under UV-light irradiation for 10 h.It is obviously seen that composite photocatalysts present excellent photocatalytic activity than that of m-CeO 2 .The result shows that the yields of CO and CH 4 are up to 15.36 mol/g and 8.02 mol/g for g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/CeO 2 , respectively.For bare m-CeO 2 , the generation of CO and CH 4 reach to Fig.7.The N 2 adsorption/desorption isotherm curves of m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 photocatalysts (a) and corresponding pore size distribution curves (b). Photocurrent (A/cm2 ) Fig. 9. (a) The transient photocurrent spectra and (b) corresponding EIS Nyquist plots of m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 photocatalyst, respectively. Fig. 11.g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst five-cycle experimental diagram (a) and XRD patterns before and after the fifth cycle. Fig. 12. Schematic illustration of g-C 3 N 4 /7Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst for CO 2 photoconversion under UV-light irradiation. EO 20PO 70EO 20, 5800) and TEOS were purchased from Sigma-Aldrich Reagent Co., Ltd.HCl (36-38), vitamin C, sodium hydroxide (NaOH, AR), triethanolamine (TEOA, AR) and urea (CON 2 H 4 , CR) were get from Sinopharm Chemical Reagent Co., Ltd.Cerium nitrate hexahydrate (Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O, AR), polyvinylpyrrolidone (PVP, k30, AR) and silver nitrate (AgNO 3 , AR) were purchased from Aladdin Chemical Reagent Co. Ltd. 1.04 mol/g and 0.64 mol/g, respectively.The yields of other photocatalysts of CO can reach 6.95 mol/g, 9.13 mol/g, 11.00 mol/g, 13.44 mol/g and 11.44 mol/g for 1Ag/m-CeO 2 , 3Ag/m-CeO 2 , 5Ag/ m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and 9Ag/m-CeO 2 , respectively.Besides, 2.63 mol/g, 5.01 mol/g, 5.31 mol/g, 6.90 mol/g and 6.11 mol/g of CH 4 are generated after irradiation for 10 h.The results demonstrate that as the Ag load increases, the photocatalytic activity of binary composite photocatalysts gradually increases and then decreases.When the loading of Ag is 7 wt, the binary photocatalyst has superior photocatalytic activity.The reason can be ascribed to Ag particles are formed on the surface of m-CeO 2 . Supplementary data to this article can be found online at https:// doi.org/10.1016/j.apsusc.2019.144931.

lamp.source: 300 W ( 420 nm) xenon lamp was used as the light source during the process of transient photocurrent test.
lamp.context: 2.3.Synthesis of mesoporous CeO 2 (m-CeO 2 ) photocatalyst 0.8017 g of Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O and 0.5 g of SBA-15 were dispersed into 30 mL water and stirred 48 h under ambient temperature.After stirring, the suspension was died at 60 C overnight.The powder was grinded and calcined at 500 C in the muffle furnace for 2 h with a rate of 2.5 C/ min.The binary composite of CeO 2 /SBA-15 was obtained.The mesoporous CeO 2 was synthesized by removing the SBA-15 template with a hot alkali solution. 2.4.Synthesis of Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalysts 0.5 g of m-CeO 2 and 50 mg of PVP were placed in 50 mL of deionized water, and ultrasonic dispersion 1 h.394 L of AgNO 3 solution (20 mg/mL) were added into above suspension solution and stirred 30 min.Subsequently, 5 mL of vitamin C (0.5 M) solution was added to the mixture.The solution turned brown and black, and was stirred for 24 h.After stirring, the obtain sample was filtered, washed, dried in a vacuum drying oven, and collected to obtain the 1 wtAg/m-CeO 2 composite, denoted as 1Ag/m-CeO 2 .Same synthetic way, the 3Ag/m-CeO 2 , 5Ag/m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and 9Ag/m-CeO 2 were synthesized via adding different AgNO 3 solution. 2.5.Synthesis of g-C 3 N 4 /Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalysts 2.0 g of urea and 0.5 g optimized Ag/m-CeO 2 binary composite photocatalysts were mixed and ground for 1 h.The ground mixture powder was transferred into a porcelain boat and placed in the tube furnace calcined in 500 C for 2 h, with a heating step of 5 C/min.The whole process was carried out in a nitrogen atmosphere.After calcination, the obtained sample was washed for several times with deionized water and absolute ethanol, vacuum drying to obtain the g-C 3 N 4 / Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst. The X-ray diffraction patterns were performance on XRD-diffractometer (XRD, AXS D8 Germany).The content of element was tested on ICP spectrometer (ICP-OES, VISTA-MPX, Varian USA).The morphologies, particles size, nanostructure were examined on field emission scanning electron microscopy (FE-SEM, 7800F Japan) and transmission electron microscopy (TEM, JEOL JEM-2100).The lattice distribution of obtained samples were investigated by FEI Tenai G2 F30 S-Twin.The surface chemical states and different valence states of samples were analyzed on X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy spectrometer using Mg K radiation (XPS, Escalab 250Xi Thermo Fisher Scientific USA).The specific surface area of samples were detected by N 2 adsorption/desorption isotherms, which were performed on Nova 2020 (BET, Micromertics USA).The optical properties of as-prepared samples were measured by UV-vis diffuse reflectance spectroscopy (DRS, UV-2450 Shimazu Japan) and the BaSO 4 as the reference.The oxygen vacancies was examined on electron paramagnetic resonance spectrometer at 297 K (EPR, Bruker A300-10/12 Germany). The transient photocurrent, linear sweep voltammetry (LSV) and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) plot were tested by a standard three-electrode system.0.5 M Na 2 SO 4 solution, Pt sheet, and Ag/AgCl electrode were served as electrolyte solution, counter electrode, and reference electrode, respectively.The obtained different samples were served as working electrode.0.03 g of as-synthesized samples, 0.01 g of PVP (k 5800) and 30 L of oleic acid were put into 3 mL of ethanol to mixture uniform.Then, the suspension was spincoated on FTO conducting glass (1 cm 1 cm).300 W ( 420 nm) xenon lamp was used as the light source during the process of transient photocurrent test.The time intervals of light on and light off was about 35 s. The CO 2 photoreduction was performed using a closed photochemical reactor with a volume of 300 mL at 0.4 MPa pressure and room temperature.0.1 g photocatalyst, 100 mL NaOH (0.1 M) solution and a certain amount of triethanolamine (TEOA) were added into the photochemical reactor.Subsequently, it was bubbled by CO 2 gas for 30 min to remove the impurities gases.Turn off air inlet and air outlet until the inner pressure was 0.4 MPa.The 8 W UV-light lamp was used as the light source.After every 1 h, the gas products were detected by the gas chromatography (GC-7920, China) FID-II detector.

reaction medium.source: 0.1 g photocatalyst, 100 mL NaOH (0.1 M) solution and a certain amount of triethanolamine (TEOA) were added into the photochemical reactor.
reaction medium.context: 2.3.Synthesis of mesoporous CeO 2 (m-CeO 2 ) photocatalyst 0.8017 g of Ce(NO 3 ) 3 6H 2 O and 0.5 g of SBA-15 were dispersed into 30 mL water and stirred 48 h under ambient temperature.After stirring, the suspension was died at 60 C overnight.The powder was grinded and calcined at 500 C in the muffle furnace for 2 h with a rate of 2.5 C/ min.The binary composite of CeO 2 /SBA-15 was obtained.The mesoporous CeO 2 was synthesized by removing the SBA-15 template with a hot alkali solution. 2.4.Synthesis of Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalysts 0.5 g of m-CeO 2 and 50 mg of PVP were placed in 50 mL of deionized water, and ultrasonic dispersion 1 h.394 L of AgNO 3 solution (20 mg/mL) were added into above suspension solution and stirred 30 min.Subsequently, 5 mL of vitamin C (0.5 M) solution was added to the mixture.The solution turned brown and black, and was stirred for 24 h.After stirring, the obtain sample was filtered, washed, dried in a vacuum drying oven, and collected to obtain the 1 wtAg/m-CeO 2 composite, denoted as 1Ag/m-CeO 2 .Same synthetic way, the 3Ag/m-CeO 2 , 5Ag/m-CeO 2 , 7Ag/m-CeO 2 and 9Ag/m-CeO 2 were synthesized via adding different AgNO 3 solution. 2.5.Synthesis of g-C 3 N 4 /Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalysts 2.0 g of urea and 0.5 g optimized Ag/m-CeO 2 binary composite photocatalysts were mixed and ground for 1 h.The ground mixture powder was transferred into a porcelain boat and placed in the tube furnace calcined in 500 C for 2 h, with a heating step of 5 C/min.The whole process was carried out in a nitrogen atmosphere.After calcination, the obtained sample was washed for several times with deionized water and absolute ethanol, vacuum drying to obtain the g-C 3 N 4 / Ag/m-CeO 2 composite photocatalyst. The CO 2 photoreduction was performed using a closed photochemical reactor with a volume of 300 mL at 0.4 MPa pressure and room temperature.0.1 g photocatalyst, 100 mL NaOH (0.1 M) solution and a certain amount of triethanolamine (TEOA) were added into the photochemical reactor.Subsequently, it was bubbled by CO 2 gas for 30 min to remove the impurities gases.Turn off air inlet and air outlet until the inner pressure was 0.4 MPa.The 8 W UV-light lamp was used as the light source.After every 1 h, the gas products were detected by the gas chromatography (GC-7920, China) FID-II detector.
